title: Network-Based Collaborative Mathematics Problem-Solving Project

context.prior_knowledge: High School-Level Mathematics Foundation and Applied Mathematical Experience in Workplace Contexts
context.additional_context: Enhancing practical mathematical problem-solving skills through online collaborative learning in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment

learning_goals: Learners collaboratively derive solutions to mathematics problems based on real-world work scenarios at least three times
Learners demonstrate mathematical communication skills through network-based discussions in mobile environments with over 80% participation

At the end of a 6-month long-term course, learners will present a math model (regression analysis, probability modeling) applied to a corporate problem (inventory optimization, budget analysis) via a 10-page report and 15-minute presentation, achieving ≥3 points in each of 4 rubric items (problem definition, model suitability, result interpretation, practical utility; total ≥9/12 points) to demonstrate real-world application of math concepts.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
